item.title: AWS Lambda
item.description: This module supports the AWS Lambda server-less architecture.

item.title: Advanced CSV
item.description: A CSV template is defined with a *.csv.properties file. This properties gives you options to change general configuration, define format or provide custom validation.

item.title: Batch monitoring
item.description: You can use the monitoring add-on batch module to inspect execution results of Spring batch jobs, executions and steps.

item.title: Custom parsers
item.description: If available parsers don’t fit your needs, the IO add-on provide an SPI for custom parsers. There are three options to provide your own parser: static template, dynamic template or without template.

item.title: Custom renderers
item.description: If available renderers don’t fit your needs, the IO add-on provides an SPI to register your custom renderers. There are three options to provide your own renderer: static template, dynamic template or without template.

item.title: Eureka
item.description: This component is used to discover services for the purpose of load balancing and failover of middle-tier servers.

item.title: Hystrix
item.description: This component allows you to wrap your network calls with the Hystrix library. Hystrix is a library that add latency tolerance and fault tolerance logic, as well as metrics.

item.title: JPA with the business framework
item.description: While you can do plain JPA by injecting EntityManager anywhere, it is better to define an architectural layer where you encapsulate persistence-related operations. In the business framework, persistence is confined to Repositories. JPA repository Default JPA repository The JPA add-on will provide a default JPA repository implementation for every aggregate that does not have a custom one. Two cases may occur: You don’t have any custom repository interface an particular aggregate.

item.title: Morphia
item.description: Morphia is an Object/Document mapper. It provides annotation-based POJO mapping, and fluent query/update APIs. SeedStack MongoDb add-on provides a module for Morphia.

item.title: REST
item.description: This module can expose REST APIs for doing CRUD operations on aggregates, through their DTO.

item.title: Spring batch
item.description: The SeedStack/Spring bridge add-on provides a Spring Batch specific integration. Spring-Batch is a comprehensive solution to implement full-featured batch jobs in Java.

item.title: Transactions
item.description: The SeedStack/Spring bridge add-on allows to trigger transactions across framework boundaries.

item.title: Audit
item.description: The Audit add-on provides the ability to trace who does what in your application.

item.title: Consul
item.description: The Consul add-on allows you to configure, inject and use Java Consul clients.

item.title: Core
item.description: SeedStack Spring bridge add-on is a bi-directional injection bridge between SeedStack (Guice) and Spring. It allows to inject Spring beans with Guice and vice-versa.

item.title: Data security
item.description: SeedStack data security add-on provides data obfuscation for any POJO according to the application security policy. The goal is to protect the data exposed by an application.

item.title: ElasticSearch
item.description: The ElasticSearch add-on allows you to configure, inject and use ElasticSearch clients.

item.title: Feign
item.description: This component allows you to define an HTTP client with a simple Java interface that you can then inject and use transparently in your code.

item.title: Flyway
item.description: SeedStack Flyway add-on provides support for automatic database migration through Flyway. For more information about Flyway: https://flywaydb.org/documentation/ Dependency Maven Gradle <dependency> <groupId>org.seedstack.addons.flyway</groupId> <artifactId>flyway</artifactId><version>2.0.0</version> </dependency> Specifying versions manually is error-prone, use dependency management instead. Show version dependencies { compile("org.seedstack.addons.flyway:flyway:2.0.0") } Configuration To enable database migration, a properly configured datasource is required: jdbc: datasources: someDatasource: url: jdbc:hsqldb:mem:somedb With only this configuration, the Flyway add-on will lookup for SQL migration scripts in the db/migration/<dsName> classpath location and if it finds any, will apply the necessary scripts to upgrade the database to the latest version.

item.title: I18n
item.description: The i18n addon provides backend services and a Web UI to manage your application’s locales and translations.

item.title: JCR Configuration
item.description: SeedStack JCR add-on supports any JCR-compliant Repository Content to allow your application to interface with a repository content.

item.title: JCache
item.description: The JCache add-on integrates the JCache API (a.k.a. JSR 107) which allows to interact with compliant caching providers in a declarative or a programmatic way.

item.title: JDBC
item.description: SeedStack JDBC add-on provides support for connection to any relational database through the JDBC API.

item.title: JMH
item.description: SeedStack JMH add-on provides integration of JMH which is a harness for building benchmarks.

item.title: JMS
item.description: Java Message Service (JMS) is a Java API that allows applications to create, send, receive, and read messages. SeedStack JMS add-on provides a JMS 1.1 integration (JSR 914).

item.title: JPA Configuration
item.description: SeedStack JPA add-on supports any JPA-compliant ORM to allow your application to interface with relational databases.

item.title: JavaMail
item.description: The JavaMail add-on integrates JavaMail API (JSR 919) with SeedStack.

item.title: Kafka
item.description: Apache Kafka is a scalable distributed streaming platform. It’s best suited for handling real-time data streams. The Kafka add-on provides an integration of both streams and pub/sub clients, using the Kafka API. Dependencies To add the Kafka add-on to your project, add the following dependency: Maven Gradle <dependency> <groupId>org.seedstack.addons.kafka</groupId> <artifactId>kafka</artifactId><version>2.0.2</version> </dependency> Specifying versions manually is error-prone, use dependency management instead. Show version dependencies { compile("org.

item.title: LDAP
item.description: SeedStack LDAP addon enables your application to connect to an LDAP directory to identify, authenticate and authorize users.

item.title: MQTT
item.description: MQTT is a light-weight publish-subscribe messaging protocol particularly suited for IoT communication. This add-on provides an integration of the MQTT protocol in SeedStack. It uses the Eclipse PAHO implementation to automatically manage brokers, connections and message consumers/publishers. Automatic connection recovery is done after an MQTT connection failure.

item.title: Metrics
item.description: SeedStack metrics add-on provides integration of CodaHale Metrics to monitor applicative metrics and health.

item.title: MongoDB
item.description: SeedStack MongoDB add-on provides integration of MongoDB Java clients your application to connect with MongoDB instances.

item.title: Neo4J
item.description: Coming soon…

item.title: OAuth
item.description: Seedstack OAuth add-on provides the ability to authenticate and authorize subjects using OAuth and OpenID Connect. Dependencies Maven Gradle <dependency> <groupId>org.seedstack.addons.oauth</groupId> <artifactId>oauth</artifactId><version>3.3.0</version> </dependency> Specifying versions manually is error-prone, use dependency management instead. Show version dependencies { compile("org.seedstack.addons.oauth:oauth:3.3.0") } In a Web context you also need to add the following dependency (otherwise security filters will be ignored): Maven Gradle <dependency> <groupId>org.

item.title: Overview
item.description: SeedStack Amazon Web Service (AWS) add-on provides integration between popular AWS products and SeedStack.

item.title: Overview
item.description: The CRUD add-on is a business framework extension that can expose CRUD operations for any Aggregate/DTO couple.

item.title: Overview
item.description: The IO add-on gives simple way to export and import data in multiple formats.

item.title: Overview
item.description: The SeedStack monitoring add-on provides modules exposing API which report the monitoring status of your application to Web clients.

item.title: Overview
item.description: SeedStack Netflix add-on provides integration for several Netflix open-source components useful for cloud and micro-services architectures.

item.title: Redis
item.description: Coming soon…

item.title: Scheduling
item.description: Scheduling add-on provides a simple API to schedule task in Seed.

item.title: Shell
item.description: SeedStack shell add-on provides access to application administrative commands through SSH protocol.

item.title: Solr
item.description: Coming soon…

item.title: Swagger
item.description: SeedStack Swagger add-on exposes a REST resource describing annotated JAX-RS resources in the Swagger format. Dependency To automatically generate and expose a Swagger descriptor for your application, add the following dependency: Maven Gradle <dependency> <groupId>org.seedstack.addons.swagger</groupId> <artifactId>swagger</artifactId><version>2.1.3</version> </dependency> Specifying versions manually is error-prone, use dependency management instead. Show version dependencies { compile("org.seedstack.addons.swagger:swagger:2.1.3") } Configuration No configuration is needed for basic usage, but the options below can be used to tune the generated Swagger.

item.title: W20 bridge
item.description: The SeedStack W20 bridge acts as an integration bridge between the Seed Java framework and the W20 Web framework.

item.title: Web bridge
item.description: The SeedStack Web bridge is an API that enables to quickly integrate your Web frontend to your SeedStack backend.

item.title: Web-Services
item.description: SeedStack Web-Services add-on provides JAX-WS integration through the Metro reference implementation.
